messages.content: What is Stable Diffusion and who proposed it?
Stable Diffusion is a text-to-image model that empowers people to create stunning art within seconds. It was proposed by Patrick Esser, Robin Rombach and the Stability AI team.
What are some key features of Stable Diffusion?

Stable Diffusion is a breakthrough in speed and quality, capable of running on consumer GPUs. It builds upon the work of the team at CompVis and Runway in their widely used latent diffusion model combined with insights from conditional diffusion models by Katherine Crowson, Dall-E 2 by Open AI, Imagen by Google Brain and many others.
What architecture does Stable Diffusion use?
Stable Diffusion has the same architecture as Latent Diffusion but uses a frozen CLIP Text Encoder instead of training the text encoder jointly with the diffusion model.
Where can I find an in-detail explanation of the Stable Diffusion model?
An in-detail explanation of the Stable Diffusion model can be found under the blog post 'Stable Diffusion with ğŸ§¨ Diffusers' on the Hugging Face website.
How can I use Stable Diffusion without relying on the Hugging Face Hub and passing an authentication token?

You can download the weights of Stable Diffusion to a local path using 'git lfs install; git clone https://huggingface.co/runwayml/stable-diffusion-v1-5' and pass the local path to the cloned folder to 'from_pretrained'.
What are some available pipelines for Stable Diffusion and what tasks can they perform?

Some available pipelines for Stable Diffusion include 'pipeline_stable_diffusion.py' for Text-to-Image Generation, 'pipeline_stable_diffusion_img2img' for Image-to-Image Text-Guided Generation, and 'pipeline_stable_diffusion_inpaint' for Text-Guided Image Inpainting.
Can Stable Diffusion work with different samplers?
Yes, Stable Diffusion can work with a variety of different samplers such as the default PLMS scheduler, DDIM scheduler and K-LMS scheduler.
Define the model name and describe briefly how it works.

The model name is {{ model_name | default('ComfyUI_CrossImageAttention') }}. This model is trained on the {{ dataset_name }} dataset using the {{ model_name | default('ğŸ¤— Diffusers') }} library.
